content:
ICS 1C: Course Schedule

Times and Places:

  • Class Meetings: MWF 11-11:50a.m., Engineering Tower 202
  • Labs: OAC PC Lab: Engineering and Computing Trailer, campus building 317
    • Monday 7:30am-11:00am
    • Tuesday 9:00am-11:00am
    • Tuesday 3:00pm-5:00pm
    • Wednesday 7:30am-11:00am
    • Thursday 9:00am-11:00am
    • Thursday 4:00pm-6:00pm
  • The UCI OAC Open Access Labs are also available for your use 24 hours daily.

Reading Assignments:

The text is The World Wide Web Unleashed by John December and Neil Randall.
  • Jan 9: As We May Think,V. Bush, 1945. (hypertext version)
  • Jan 11,13: CACM
  • Jan 18,20: Text: Chapters 1-13
  • Jan 30, Feb 1: Text: Chapters 14, 15, 29, 33, 37, and (review) 1-13
    Also browse ICS 1C HTML References and read one closely.
  • March 1-7: Read John December's New Spiders Roam the Web and ``explore'' at least 2 of the Web searching resources given in there or in Searching the Web. ``Explore'' means ``read the documentation and (try to) use.''
    ``Scalable Internet Resource Discovery: Research Problems and Approaches,'' C. Mic Bowan, Peter B. Danzig, Udi Manber, and Michael F. Schwartz, Communications of the ACM,
    v.37, No.8, Aug 1994, pp. 98-107.

Lab Assignments:

  • Lab Exercise #1: Send e-mail to ics1c@ics.uci.edu with names of your team members and what lab hours you are scheduled to meet with them. You can come to whichever lab hours you want and are not limited regarding with whom you work. There is also an on-line sign up form for a lab sections.
  • Lab Exercise 1 (Feedback)
  • Lab Exercise 2 (Feedback)
  • Lab Exercise 3. Also (UCI Access Only): What students submitted, Histogram of scores, Grading notes and details.
  • Lab Exercise 4 and how it will be assessed

Quizzes and Final Exam:

  • Quiz 1, Monday, January 23, 1995
  • Quiz 2, Monday, February 6, 1995
  • Quiz 3, Friday, February 24, 1995
  • Quiz 4, Monday, March 13, 1995
  • Final Exam, Wednesday, March 22, 1995, 10:30a.m.-12:30p.m.
This information brought to you by www.ics.uci.edu
Current as of 8 March 1995
Please send comments to ics1c@ics.uci.edu, including the URL to which your comments apply.
